member.name: T:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer
member.summary: This is a Lucene.Net Examine indexer for Umbraco

remarks.para: Some links picked up along the way:
A matrix of concurrent lucene operations: http://www.jguru.com/faq/view.jsp?EID=913302.

Based on the info here, it is best to only call optimize when there is no activity, we only optimized after the queue has been processed and at start up: http://www.gossamer-threads.com/lists/lucene/java-dev/47895 http://lucene.apache.org/java/2_2_0/api/org/apache/lucene/index/IndexWriter.html

member.name: F:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.SortedFieldNamePrefix
member.summary: The prefix added to a field when it is included in the index for sorting

member.name: F:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.OptimizationCommitThreshold
member.summary: Specifies how many index commits are performed before running an optimization

member.name: F:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.IndexTypeFieldName
member.summary: Used to store a non-tokenized key for the document

member.name: F:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.IndexNodeIdFieldName
member.summary: Used to store a non-tokenized type for the document

member.name: F:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.IndexPathFieldName
member.summary: Used to store the path of a content object

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.#ctor(Examine.IIndexCriteria,System.IO.DirectoryInfo)
member.summary: Constructor to allow for creating an indexer at runtime

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.Initialize(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Set up all properties for the indexer based on configuration information specified. This will ensure that all of the folders required by the indexer are created and exist. This will also create an instruction file declaring the computer name that is part taking in the indexing. This file will then be used to determine the master indexer machine in a load balanced environment (if one exists).
member.param: The friendly name of the provider.
A collection of the name/value pairs representing the provider-specific attributes specified in the configuration for this provider.
member.exception: The name of the provider is null.
The name of the provider has a length of zero.
An attempt is made to call on a provider after the provider has already been initialized.

member.name: F:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.m_IndexerLocker
member.summary: Used to perform thread locking

member.name: F:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.m_FolderLocker
member.summary: used to thread lock calls for creating and verifying folders

member.name: F:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.m_IsIndexing
member.summary: Used for double check locking during an index operation

member.name: F:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.m_InternalSearcher
member.summary: We need an internal searcher used to search against our own index. This is used for finding all descendant nodes of a current node when deleting indexes.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.ReIndexNode(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.String)
member.summary: Forces a particular XML node to be reindexed

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.RebuildIndex
member.summary: Rebuilds the entire index from scratch for all index types
member.remarks: This will completely delete the index and recreate it

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.DeleteFromIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a node from the index.
member.remarks: When a content node is deleted, we also need to delete it's children from the index so we need to perform a custom Lucene search to find all decendents and create Delete item queues for them too.
member.param: ID of the node to delete

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.IndexAll(System.String)
member.summary: Re-indexes all data for the index type specified

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.AddSingleNodeToIndex(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.String)
member.summary: Adds single node to index. If the node already exists, a duplicate will probably be created, To re-index, use the ReIndexNode method.
member.param: The type to store the node as.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.OptimizeIndex
member.summary: This wil optimize the index for searching, this gets executed when this class instance is instantiated.
member.remarks: This can be an expensive operation and should only be called when there is no indexing activity

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.DeleteFromIndex(Lucene.Net.Index.Term,Lucene.Net.Index.IndexReader)
member.summary: Removes the specified term from the index
member.returns: Boolean if it successfully deleted the term, or there were on errors

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.ValidateDocument(System.Xml.Linq.XElement)
member.summary: Ensures that the node being indexed is of a correct type and is a descendent of the parent id specified.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.GetDataToIndex(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.String)
member.summary: Collects all of the data that needs to be indexed as defined in the index set.
member.returns: A dictionary representing the data which will be indexed

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.AddDocument(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},Lucene.Net.Index.IndexWriter,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Collects the data for the fields and adds the document which is then committed into Lucene.Net's index
member.param: The fields and their associated data.
The writer that will be used to update the Lucene index.
The type to index the node as.
The path of the content node
member.remarks: This will normalize (lowercase) all text before it goes in to the index.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.SafelyProcessQueueItems
member.summary: Process all of the queue items. This checks if this machine is the Executive and if it's in a load balanced environments. If then acts accordingly: Not the executive = doesn't index, i In async mode = use file watcher timer

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.ForceProcessQueueItems
member.summary: Loop through all files in the queue item folder and index them. Regardless of weather this machine is the executive indexer or not or is in a load balanced environment or not, this WILL attempt to process the queue items into the index.
member.returns: The number of queue items processed
member.remarks: Inheritors should be very carefully using this method, SafelyProcessQueueItems will ensure that the correct machine processes the items into the index. SafelyQueueItems calls this method if it confirms that this machine is the one to process the queue.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.GetXDocument(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns an XDocument for the entire tree stored for the IndexType specified.
member.param: The type of data to request from the data service.
member.returns: Either the Content or Media xml. If the type is not of those specified null is returned

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.SaveDeleteIndexQueueItem(System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Saves a file indicating that the executive indexer should remove the from the index those that match the term saved in this file. This will save a file prefixed with the current machine name with an extension of .del

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.SaveAddIndexQueueItem(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the information for the fields to a file names with the computer's name that is running the index and a GUID value. The indexer will then index the values stored in the files in another thread so that processing may continue. This will save a file prefixed with the current machine name with an extension of .add
member.param: The path of the content node

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.ReInitialize
member.summary: This makes sure that the folders exist, that the executive indexer is setup and that the index is optimized. This is called at app startup when the providers are initialized but called again if folder are missing during a an indexing operation.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.m_FileWatcher_Elapsed(System.Object,System.Timers.ElapsedEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the file watcher timer poll elapsed event This will: - Disable the FileSystemWatcher - Recursively process all queue items in the folder and check after processing if any more files have been added - Once there's no more files to be processed, re-enables the watcher

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.GetExclusiveIndexWriter(Lucene.Net.Index.IndexWriter@,Lucene.Net.Index.IndexReader@)
member.summary: Checks the writer passed in to see if it is active, if not, checks if the index is locked. If it is locked, returns checks if the reader is not null and tries to close it. if it's still locked returns null, otherwise creates a new writer.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.GetExclusiveIndexReader(Lucene.Net.Index.IndexReader@,Lucene.Net.Index.IndexWriter@)
member.summary: Checks the reader passed in to see if it is active, if not, checks if the index is locked. If it is locked, returns checks if the writer is not null and tries to close it. if it's still locked returns null, otherwise creates a new reader.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.ProcessDeleteQueueItem(System.IO.FileInfo,Lucene.Net.Index.IndexReader)
member.summary: Reads the FileInfo passed in into a dictionary object and deletes it from the index

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.ProcessAddQueueItem(System.IO.FileInfo,Lucene.Net.Index.IndexWriter)
member.summary: Reads the FileInfo passed in into a dictionary object and adds it to the index

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.GetFieldValue(System.String)
member.summary: All field data will be stored into Lucene as is except for dates, these can be stored as standard: yyyyMMdd Any standard text will be put in lower case format.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.AddNodesToIndex(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds all nodes with the given xPath root.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.VerifyFolder(System.IO.DirectoryInfo)
member.summary: Creates the folder if it does not exist.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.IndexReady
member.summary: Checks if the index is ready to open/write to.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.IndexExists
member.summary: Check if there is an index in the index folder

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.CheckDisposed
member.summary: Checks the disposal state of the objects

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.Dispose
member.summary: When the object is disposed, all data should be written

member.name: P:UmbracoExamine.LuceneExamineIndexer.SupportProtectedContent

member.summary: Returns the DirectoryInfo object for the index path.

member.name: P:UmbracoExamine.Config.IndexSet.IndexParentId
member.summary: When this property is set, the indexing will only index documents that are children of this node.

member.name: P:UmbracoExamine.Config.IndexSet.IncludeNodeTypes
member.summary: The collection of node types to index, if not specified, all node types will be indexed (apart from the ones specified in the ExcludeNodeTypes collection).

member.name: P:UmbracoExamine.Config.IndexSet.ExcludeNodeTypes
member.summary: The collection of node types to not index. If specified, these node types will not be indexed.

member.name: P:UmbracoExamine.Config.IndexSet.IndexUserFields
member.summary: A collection of user defined umbraco fields to index
member.remarks: If this property is not specified, or if it's an empty collection, the default user fields will be all user fields defined in Umbraco

member.name: P:UmbracoExamine.Config.IndexSet.IndexAttributeFields
member.summary: The fields umbraco values that will be indexed. i.e. id, nodeTypeAlias, writer, etc...
member.remarks: If this is not specified, or if it's an empty collection, the default optins will be specified: - id - version - parentID - level - writerID - creatorID - nodeType - template - sortOrder - createDate - updateDate - nodeName - urlName - writerName - creatorName - nodeTypeAlias - path

member.name: T:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive
member.summary: Manages the delegation of authority over which machine in a load balanced environment will perform the indexing. This is done by an IO race on initialization of the LuceneExamineIndexer. If a server's app pool is recycled at a seperate time than the rest of the servers in the cluster, it will generally take over the executive role (this is dependant on the time that the last latest server's app pool was restarted). The Executive is determined by file lock (.lck) file, theoretically there should only be one of these. If there is only 1 server in the cluster, then obviously it is the Executive.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive.IsInitialized
member.summary: Determines if the executive has been initialized. This is useful for checking if files have been deleted during website operations.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive.TimestampTimer_Elapsed(System.Object,System.Timers.ElapsedEventArgs)
member.summary: Fired every 10 minutes by the timer object. This timestamps the EXA file to enure the system knows that this server is active. This is to ensure that all systems in a Load Balanced environment are aware of exactly how many other servers are taking part in the load balancing and who they are.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive.CreateEXAFile
member.summary: Creates an xml file to declare that this machine is taking part in the index writing. This is used to determine the master indexer if this app exists in a load balanced environment.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive.CreateLCKFile
member.summary: Creates a lock file for this machine if there aren't other ones.
member.returns: returns true if a lock file was successfully created for this machine.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive.ClearOldLCKFiles(System.DateTime)
member.summary: delete all old lck files (any that are more than cutoffTime old)

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive.ClearOldEXAFiles(System.DateTime)
member.summary: delete all old exa files (any that are more than cutoffTime old)

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive.GetOtherLCKFiles
member.summary: Get all lck files that are not named by this machines name. If there are any, this means that another machine has won the race and created the lck file for itself. If there is a lck file with the current machines name, then this must mean it was previously the master indexer and the apppool has recycled in less than the hour.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive.TimestampLck
member.summary: Updates the timestamp for lck file if it exists

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive.TimestampEXA
member.summary: Updates the timestamp for the exa file

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive.GetEXA
member.summary: Read the machines EXA file

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive.GetLCK
member.summary: Read the machines LCK file

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive.RaceForMasterIndexer
member.summary: This will check for any lock files, not created by the current machine. If there are any, then this machine will flag it's exa file as not being the master indexer, otherwise, it will try to create it's own lock file to let others know it is the race winner and therefore the master indexer. If this succeeds, it will update it's exa file to flag it as the master indexer.

member.name: M:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive.Dispose
member.summary: When the object is disposed, all data should be written

member.name: P:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive.IsExecutiveMachine
member.summary: Ensures there is an elected Executive, otherwise starts the race. Returns a bool as to whether or not this is the Executive machine.

member.name: P:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive.IsLoadBalancedEnvironment
member.summary: Returns a boolean determining whether or not this server involved in a LoadBalanced environment with Umbraco Examine.

member.name: P:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive.ExecutiveIndexerMachineName
member.summary: Returns the machine name of the executive indexer

member.name: P:UmbracoExamine.IndexerExecutive.ServerCount
member.summary: The number of servers active in indexing

member.summary: Gets the doc id at a specified index
